text: Warren Skorodenski (born March 22, 1960 in Winnipeg, Manitoba) is a Canadian retired professional ice hockey goaltender. Frederick played a total of 35 games in the National Hockey League (NHL) with the Chicago Black Hawks and Edmonton Oilers. ==Career== He played for the New Brunswick Hawks, the AHL affiliate of the Black Hawks. During that time, he was able to win the Harry "Hap" Holmes Memorial Award for being the goalie with the lowest goals against average and shared the award with his teammate Bob Janecyk. He was called up by the Black Hawks during the 1981-82 NHL season. He played 1 game and was sent back down to the AHL where he played 4 seasons and 1 season in the CHL with the Birmingham South Stars. During the 1984-85 NHL season, he was called up and played as Murray Bannerman backup. He recorded the league's highest save percentage, at 0.903. In 1987, he signed a contract with the Edmonton Oilers and played 3 games with them. He retired from playing professional ice hockey in 1990. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Calgary Wranglers players Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Cape Breton Oilers players Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Edmonton Oilers players Category:Ice hockey people from Manitoba Category:New Brunswick Hawks players Category:Nova Scotia Oilers players Category:Sherbrooke Jets players Category:Sportspeople from Winnipeg Category:Springfield Indians players
title: Warren Skorodenski
